intro: Leptocionium seselifolium, commonly known as the slender-leaved seselifolium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, calcareous soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
